text: The Camden County Board of Chosen Freeholders is a board of seven people who govern Camden County, New Jersey. The board is led by the Director and Deputy Director who are chosen by the board every year. The current Director is Freeholder Louis Capelli, Jr, and the current Deputy Director is Edward McDonnell. == Responsibilities == The board is responsible for governing the county. The board also writes, approves, and executes the counties legislation. == Party Affiliation == {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="2" |Affiliation !Members |- | style="background-color:;" | |Democratic Party | style="text-align:center;" |7 |- | style="background-color:;" | |Republican Party | style="text-align:center;" |0 |- ! colspan="2" style="text- align:center;" |Total ! style="text-align:center;" |7 |} == Sessions == === 2019 === On March 22 Freeholder William Moen resigned so he could run for New Jersey General Assembly in the 5th Legislative District. He was replaced with Melinda Kane. === Previous Sessions === {| class="wikitable" !Year !Seat 1 !Seat 2 !Seat 3 !Seat 4 !Seat 5 !Seat 6 !Seat 7 |- |2017 | rowspan="4" | Louis Capelli, Jr (D) | rowspan="4" | Edward McDonnell (D) | rowspan="3" | William Moen (D) | rowspan="4" | Susan Shin Angulo (D) | rowspan="4" | Carmen Rodriguez (D) | rowspan="4" | Jeffery Nash (D) | rowspan="4" | Jonathan Young (D) |- |2018 |- |2019 |- |2019 | | Melinda Kane (D) |} == References == Category:Camden County, New Jersey
title: Camden County Board of Chosen Freeholders
